converse.line: Hey, Adelaide! How are you holding up?
It's been rough. I can't believe we'd been robbed! I thought we chose a town with a low crime rate when we decided to buy a home in Nulato.
And they managed to steal all the furniture too.
Yeah! That stuff was worth a fortune. We're slowly buying it all back, but it's taking a while. And some things just can't be bought back...
No! They didn't steal the good luck charm your father gave you, did they?
The one day I forgot to bring it, was the day of the robbery. That charm was really important to me. The only memory I have of my father is him giving this to me before he left this planet.
If I could, I would track them down and steal it back.
Would you be able to pull that off? I mean, it was probably professional thieves if no one in town saw them.
Adelaide, you're my best friend. I would tackle any obstacle to make you happy. Even if I have to become a professional thief.
You go become a thief then.

choice.line: Do you know who the culprit is?

I have no proof, but there are rumors of there being a large gang industry in Fujita. I've never been there myself; it's too sketchy of a place for me. But if anyone were to pull off stealing everything from my house, it's probably someone from there.
Why don't you stay at my house for the time being? I'm sure my mother wouldn't mind.
Oh, that's alright. I wouldn't want to intrude. Besides, I don't think you have enough room there. It can barely fit your whole family already.
Wow, I make a generous offer and I am repaid in sass? What kind of world is this?
Certainly not one you are from.
So, the latest gossip...
Well, you know how Brad was going out with Natasha, right? It turns out that Natasha was going out with Chad at the same time!
How scandalous! It's just like Natasha, too. I swear, she...
[A half an hour later...]
...don't you DARE talk about Jessica like that! ...
[Another half an hour later...]
...and that's why I don't like those lemon cookies they sell at the mall.
I see how it is. You traitor!
...Wow, look at the time. I've got to get going.
It was good talking with you!

converse.line: A membership into the gang industry?
Actually, yes. Well, not anymore. I've done something to them they'll never forgive me for. But more importantly, I've found your charm.
......Whoa. Whoa. WHOA! I can't believe you! You did something like that for me? Far out! You don't know how much this means to me.
Whoa, don't cry. I'm happy to do anything for you, Adelaide.

choice.line: How much more furniture do you have to buy back?
We're still missing some dressers, crates, and a table, which we should earn back in about a month or two.
Do you eat on the floor?
Yes.
Oh.
That charm was cute.
I know, right! It's so kawaii! And it works, too. Just yesterday, I found a note worth #10 just lying in the street.
You lucky mustard.
Emere! Watch your language, there are children present.
Oh, sorry. I should be careful around you.
